title: Accounts Officer
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
about the company
My client is a well-established MNC which has business interests spanning across various industries. There is now an exciting opportunity for a hands-on finance professional to join their Finance team as an Accounts Officer.

about the job
Reporting to the Finance Manager, you will work within a team where you will be responsible for the full sets of accounts and being hands-on in GL, AR and AP entries. You will also be preparing GST returns and assisting in Corporate Tax filings.

skills and experience required
You should at least be qualified with a diploma/degree in Accounting or Finance. Candidates with no prior work experience can also be considered. You are proficient with Microsoft Excel and SAP. You are willing to learn and can look forward to working in a collaborative environment.

To apply online please apply on https://www.randstad.com.sg/jobs/accounts-officerexecutive_singapore_42335526/

Alternatively you may contact Michael Lai at +65 86116768. (EA: 94C3609/R2199939)

title: Accounts Executive
description:

Maintain full sets of account (AP, AR & GL functions);
Prepare and submit quarterly GST returns;
Establish and enforce proper accounting methods, policies, principles & accordance to standard requirement;
Improve systems and procedures, and initiate corrective actions;
Assist in month-end and year-end closing activities;
Manage the financial & statutory accounting for entities assigned, which includes preparation of financial statements & their notes.
Provide commentary for management reporting regarding profits, cash flow and other financial results.
Assist in the cash flow management and treasury functions.
Assist in tax matters
Other ad-hoc work as assigned by the management
REQUIREMENT:
Degree Holder in Accounting or equivalent / ACCA
At least 4 years of relevant working experience in financial reporting
Excellent analytical, mathematical and problem-solving skills
Proficient in system knowledge and computer applications, excellent Excel and PowerPoints Skills
Must be able to work independently
Able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Transportation services are provided
5 working days
Remuneration will commensurate with qualification and experience.

title: Accounts Assistant

description:

To perform day to day transactions, including verifying, classifying, computing, posting and recording account receivables & payable data.

title: Accountant II
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsible for all finance functions and activities in the Singapore office and work closely with the auditor and tax consultant.
Ensure accuracy, completeness and timeliness of accounting records to meet all internal and external reporting requirements in compliance with local and US GAAP.
Fulfill all tax filing, internal and external audit requirements.
Support supervisor on budgeting and forecasting.
Identify improvements in business processes and internal controls to ensure compliance with corporate policies and procedures.
Review costing and provide monthly margin analysis.
Demonstrated ability to develop constructive working relationships across organizational or functional boundaries.
Prepare monthly depreciation and maintain fixed asset registered.
Review months end close activities, prepare journal entry for accruals, prepayments, adjustments etc.
Understand Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable function well and provide guidance to SSC team as needed.
Prepare monthly reconciliation and provide variance analysis and commentaries.
Review capital expenditure requests to ensure business and financial justifications are sound as well as compliance to the relevant policies.
Ad-hoc activities as assigned by the supervisor.

Key Qualifications & Requirements
Education Qualification:
Bachelor degree in Commerce / Accounting.
CA qualification or equivalent.
Technical Competence & Skills:
Knowledge of US and local GAAP, local tax and statutory regulations.
Experience in ERP system (Oracle will be a distinct advantage).
Relevant Experience:
At least 5 years of experience.
Experience in Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance.
Highly organized with an excellent ability to manage multiple priorities under pressure and tight deadlines with minimum supervision.
Others:
Fluent written and spoken English.
Comfort working with senior management.
Independence and decisiveness.
High integrity and credibility.

title: Project Accountant
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A market leader in the Manufacturing industry is seeking a Project Accountant to join their fast-growing organisation.
Reporting to the Finance Director, you will be the key driver in the management of financial transactions (Payments, Receivables, Journal entities), reporting, forecasts, budgets. You will be a key business partner to functions like project engineers, managers and sales team pertaining to supplier payments, bank guarantees, cash forecasts and tax/audit preparation. This involves driving management reporting for stakeholders, as well as overseeing the fixed assets, and preparation of financial for project reviews.
The ideal candidate should have a degree in Accountancy and Finance and have minimum of 4 years of relevant project accounting experience. You enjoy working both independently and within a team, while possessing strategic thinking and the ability to drive changes for the growth of the business.
If you are keen, please click on the link to apply or email me with your updated CV at jillian.yip@ethosbc.com. Alternatively, if you are looking out within the finance space, feel free to send across your resume.

title: Accounts Assistant
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Accounts Assistant plays a vital role in supporting the financial operations of the temple. This position assists in maintaining accurate financial records, processing transactions, and providing administrative support to the Trusteeship.

In this role, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

Financial Record Keeping
o Assist in maintaining accurate and up-to-date financial records, including invoices, receipts, and other documents.
o Ensure proper filing and organisation of financial records for easy retrieval and reference.
Accounts Payable and Receivable
o Assist in processing payments to vendors, contractors, and service providers, ensuring accuracy and adherence to payment schedules.
o Assist in managing accounts receivable, including tracking donations, issuing receipts, and coordinating with donors or members for outstanding payments.
o Help with bank reconciliation by matching financial records with bank statements.

Expense Monitoring and Reconciliation
o Assist in monitoring and reconciling expense reports and receipts submitted.
o Verify the accuracy and completeness of expense documentation and ensure adherence to the temple's financial policies and procedures.

Financial Reporting
o Assist in preparing financial reports, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.
o Support generating financial reports or statements for review by senior management and MCCY
o Help collect and compile financial data for internal and external reporting and auditing purposes.
Administrative Support
o Assist in managing correspondence and communication related to financial matters, both internally and externally.
o Contribute to maintaining and organising financial files, documents, and records.
Compliance and Regulations
o Ensure compliance with financial regulations, tax laws, and reporting requirements applicable to the temple.
o Support the finance team in preparing necessary documentation or reports for audits or government agencies as needed.

About this role
o 5-Day Work Week
o Working hours: 9am – 6pm (with 1 hour lunch break)
o Annual leave/medical leave entitlements

To be shortlisted for this role you should have;
o Diploma or equivalent additional education or training in finance or accounting.
o Prior experience in a finance or accounting role is a plus.
o Proficiency in using financial software and MS Office applications, particularly Excel.
o Basic understanding of financial principles, practices, and terminology.
o Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and record keeping.
o Excellent organisational and time management skills.
o Effective communication and interpersonal abilities.
o Effectively bilingual in English and Tamil (required for this role)

title: Account Manager
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Be the primary point of contact and build long-term relationships with customers
Help customers through email, phone, online presentations, screen-share and in person meetings
Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors
Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives
Communicate clearly the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders
Forecast and track key account metrics
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations
Enhance department and organization's reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments
Responsible for keeping current clients satisfied and delivering exceptional client service on a day-to-day basis
Monitor and analyze customer's usage of our product and do market research on existing competition
Responsible for working with the Sales team to onboard and integrate new clients and developing existing client relationships.
Liaise between the customer and internal teams
Requirements:
Possess a Bachelor’s Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree in relevant field
Entry Level or up to 3 years of work experience and Proven account management or other relevant experiences.
Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to meet and establish deadlines.
Ability to work under minimum supervision and be self-motivated.
Flexibility and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills and a team player.
Experiences in the Utility Sector would have an added advantage.
Experience with enterprise software would have an added advantage
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Account Assistant
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
30 Bencoolen, is a contemporary boutique hotel located in the heart of the arts and cultural district, offers a cool and contemporary ambience in an ideal central location, a short stroll away from City Hall and Orchard Road.

Possess good interpersonal and communication skills.

title: Accounts & Admin Assistant
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for someone who has strong passion on building relationships with people and is capable with efficiently supporting day-to-day operations of the business.

About NoFrills Dental:
NoFrills Dental is a young, innovative, dynamic and fast-paced dental group based in Singapore.
We're looking for like-minded, motivated and passionate dentists & staff to grow our brand and dental clinic across Singapore.
We prioritise a healthy work-life balance for all of our dentists and staff while advocating that patients be treated with the utmost quality care at ALL times.
We place the needs and well-being of our people at the very forefront of our business. As we believe that "happy, positive & motivated people create a positive environment, which translates to happy & satisfied patients."
At NoFrills Dental, our motto when it comes to serving our patients is pretty straightforward (It's in the name) - Providing consistently high-quality dental services at affordable prices for all patients, wherever we operate.

Job Responsibilities:
The Accounts & Admin Assistant supports the finance department in carrying out the responsibilities of the finance department. He/She is involved in work that is specific to accounts receivable, accounts payable, billings and other accounting tasks.
Job Scope:
· Take responsibility for the Accounts Payables function such as handling AP vendor invoices.
· Take responsibility for the Accounts Receivables function including AR collections/following up for overdue debts.
· Perform Medisave, CHAS and AIA/IHP claims online, tally payments
· Assist in maintaining accurate financial records and statements (e.g Bank Reconciliation, updating of cash book, GST submission, Financial Report etc.)
· Perform month-end closing activities
· Assist in other ad-hoc task assigned by the Finance Executive/Manager.

Job Requirements:
· Preferably with Diploma in Accounting field or equivalent
· Minimum 1 year working experience is required for this position.
· Team player, meticulous and a positive working attitude.
· Good time management & able to multitask in a fast paced environment to meet deadlines
· Excellent eye for detail
· Able to work independently and discipline under minimum supervision.
· Candidates who are able to start immediately or within a short notice period will have an added advantage.

Working Hours:
· 5 days a week
Mon-Fri, 9am-6pm
** Attractive remuneration, yearly increments and benefits. Incentives and bonuses on good performance

title: Account Manager (Coffee)
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PPP Coffee is looking for an experienced account manager to be part of its sales and marketing team. In this role, you will be responsible for growing our commercial/wholesale business in Singapore through acquiring new business account and maintaining relationships with our existing clientele, mainly (but not limited to) within the hotels, restaurants and cafes (“HORECA”) and offices territory.

Your job includes, but is not limited to the following:
Manage a portfolio of HORECA and corporate clients including retention, development and growth.
Provide professional and timely advice to our business account for queries relating to the wholesale business/products, working in close coordination with relevant departments.
Conduct basic coffee training for wholesale clients.
Onboard new client accounts and conduct 90-day check-ins and annual reviews.
Follow up on new leads and develop new business opportunities.
Cross-sell products and/or services across the PPP Coffee Group to new and/or existing clients.
Prepare sales proposals and assist with coffee tastings and client presentations.
Meet or exceed set goals for sales and performance, working both independently and within a team.
Participate in tradeshows and/or networking events as required.
Requirements
1-3 years of experience in an account management role in an FMCG or F&B environment
Experience or knowledge in specialty coffee and/or coffee machines
Good written and spoken English
Basic Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills
Ability to communicate well with diverse groups; multi-task and perform well in a fast-paced environment
Good interpersonal and organisational skills

Benefits
Up to 19 Days Annual Leave + Birthday Leave
Free non-alcoholic beverages
Staff discounts
Complimentary monthly movie tickets
Medical and grooming benefits
10 mins walk away from Bendemeer / Lavender MRT

title: SENIOR FINANCIAL ACCOUNTANT
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Handle and maintain full sets of accounts (AP, AR & GL), including preparation of month-end closing and monthly schedules.
Help the team prepare GST submissions.
Process intercompany recharge and reconciliation.
Support all audit-related matters including preparation of audit schedule, attend to audit queries and providing requested information.
Ensure compliance with all filing requirements, eg. corporate tax, GST, audits internal controls and procedures.
Support budgeting, forecasting, cash flow, and credit control management.
Participate in system enhancements/implementation to align with new operational requirements.
Review and recommend areas where processes and procedures could be further improved for greater efficiency and strengthen internal controls.
Any ad-hoc duties assigned from the Finance team to ensure business enhancement towards the direction of growth.
Oversee Finance, Admin, and HR functions
Oversee Finance function of overseas subsidiaries
Responsible for timely and accurate Group consolidated reporting in compliance with local FRS
Manage Group’s tax planning and transfer pricing matters
Manage Group’s general ledger system
Review weekly Group’s cash flow forecast/AR & AP reports
Review monthly P&L and Balance Sheet of holding company’s local and overseas subsidiaries. Ensure group closing is accurate and within the stipulated timeline
Evaluate and improve the effectiveness and efficiency of existing accounting processes, internal controls, and procedures
Ensure that appropriate systems and internal controls are implemented and maintained
Review GST returns for Singapore and overseas subsidiaries
Prepare Group annual budget
Responsible for control of Group’s bank tokens and payment authorization
Responsible for payroll & HR matters
Review overseas subsidiaries’ payroll computation
Assist in ad hoc system implementation projects
Responsible for government grants submission
Liaise with external auditors, tax agents, company secretary, bankers, relevant government and regulatory agencies
Any other related ad hoc duties assigned

Requirements
Minimally holding a Bachelor in Business Administration, Financial Management, or Accountancy-related courses.
Must be proficient in using Microsoft Excel for financial accounting purposes.
Prior experience in dealing with accounting systems such as Xero or Microsoft Dynamics is highly preferred
Experience in Audit will be a high advantage.
Have strong attention to detail to ensure there are no errors and accurate bookkeeping activities.
Someone with good time management and the ability to deliver to deadlines as a self-starter, who can plan and organize their time effectively and take initiative to meet job objectives or even make suggestions for improvements.
Willingness to learn and curiosity to grow.
Able to work in a dynamic environment with a multicultural team.
Must communicate fluently in English to work with a global team.
Self-starter who is able to plan, organize and take initiative to meet job objectives and deadlines independently
Qualified CA/ACCA with 3+ years of relevant experience, with strong accounting fundamentals. Candidates with Big 4 experience are welcome to apply. To succeed in this role, you will be a team player who is collaborative, have strong interpersonal skills, and thrives on challenges.
